causes it is not possible to go on to infinity, because in all efficient causes following
in order, the first is the cause of the intermediate cause, and the intermediate is the
cause of the ultimate cause, whether the intermediate cause be several, or only one.
Now to remove the cause is to remove the effect. Therefore, if there be no first cause
among efficient causes, there will be no ultimate, nor any intermediate cause. But if
